intro: Quiotania columbiana, commonly known as the Columbian quiotania, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in regions of Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, lance-shaped leaves, and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
